title: North Korea launches rocket likely connected to military satellite, South Korea says
description: Following the launch, officials in South Korea's capital of Seoul sent alerts for residents to prepare for evacuation, but there were no immediate reports of damages or disruption.

title: James Comey knows the politics of NY law enforcement. Now, he's writing about it
description: Central Park West draws from James Comey's experience in the FBI and as a U.S attorney for the southern district of New York.

title: Destructive Nova Scotia wildfires force thousands of Canadians to flee their homes
description: More than a dozen fires were continuing to burn on Tuesday, and officials said over 16,000 people had evacuated under a mandatory order.

title: Far-right members threaten a 'reckoning' over McCarthy's debt limit deal
description: McCarthy, who struck a compromise deal to avoid a debt default, faces criticism from members of his own conference and a potential threat that could oust him as speaker. He says his job is secure.

title: Family of Aderrien Murry, 11-year-old shot by police, files federal lawsuit
description: The family of Aderrien Murry is seeking at least $5 million in damages. The Mississippi boy is recovering from his wounds, which include a collapsed lung, a fractured rib and a lacerated liver.

title: Why our allergies are getting worse —and what to do about it
description: From excessive hygiene to low-fiber diets, author Theresa MacPhail explores the deep-rooted causes of rising allergy rates in her new book Allergic.

title: A landmark appeals court ruling clears way for Purdue Pharma-Sackler bankruptcy deal
description: The 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals in New York cleared the way for a controversial bankruptcy deal that grants immunity from opioid lawsuits to members of the Sackler family.

title: This airline is weighing passengers before they board international flights
description: "For safety reasons we need to know the weight of all items onboard the aircraft," Air New Zealand says. Numbers from the scales won't be displayed and will remain anonymous, the airline says.

title: Heads up! Stunning birds are all around us, even in dense cities
description: If you pay attention, you can see or hear a wide variety of birds, especially in migration season.

title: 3 new books in translation blend liberation with darkness
description: The Enlightenment of Katzuo Nakamatsu, The House on Via Gemito, and Cousins together form a tour of human darkness where liberation comes in many forms.

title: Is Texas next up? Lawmakers clear the way for the state to leave voter data group ERIC
description: Texas is on its way to being the latest — and largest — state to leave a bipartisan data sharing partnership that states across the country use to cross check their voter rolls.

title: He was a beloved farming legend. But for Reddit, his work ethic meant something else
description: David Brandt, who died last week, was an Ohio farmer known for his pioneering work in no-till farming. But social media users knew him better as the overall-clad farmer from the "honest work" meme.

title: 30 international peacekeepers are injured in fierce clashes with Serbs in Kosovo
description: A statement said that 11 Italian soldiers and 19 Hungarian ones "sustained multiple injuries, including fractures and burns from improvised explosive incendiary devices."

title: Advocates: Reparations is the answer for sea level threat in West Oakland, Calif.
description: Reparations is one way to confront the rising sea levels in West Oakland, Calif.

title: People fleeing Sudan face uncertain futures in Egypt, Saudi Arabia and beyond
description: In Port Sudan, Jeddah, Aswan and Cairo, people have sought safety from the fighting in Khartoum. After making difficult decisions and journeys, the biggest challenges for many are only beginning.

title: The first office for missing and murdered Black women and girls set for Minnesota
description: The office will investigate cold cases and reopen suspicious cases, assist police agencies and community groups in active cases, and serve as a point of contact for those reluctant to talk to police.

title: When a second grader doesn't have lunch, a teacher steps in to save the day
description: It took a teacher to spot that Evelyn Flores didn't have any food. The hour that followed set the young student on a path to teaching.

title: Why Florida's new immigration law is troubling businesses and workers alike
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis says the penalties for companies that violate new employment requirements will help the state prosper. But businesses and immigrant activists alike say it'll do more harm than good.

title: Elizabeth Holmes starts her 11-year prison sentence today. Here's what to know
description: The onetime Silicon Valley star is expected to surrender herself to federal authorities at the Bryan, Texas, prison camp, an all-female facility about 100 miles outside of Houston.

title: Secrets of the National Spelling Bee: Picking the words to identify a champion
description: On the eve of the annual Scripps National Spelling Bee, its word selection panel has worked long hours to approve all words, including their spellings, pronunciations and languages of origin.

title: Russia launches a pre-dawn air raid on Kyiv as Moscow says it is attacked by drones
description: Russia launched a pre-dawn air raid on Ukraine's capital Tuesday, killing at least one person while Moscow authorities said the Russian capital was attacked by drones.

title: China launches a new crew into space, including its first civilian astronaut
description: China's space program officials said on Monday they have plans to expand its space station, along with launching a crewed mission to the moon before 2030.

title: At least 9 people injured in shooting at Florida beach boardwalk
description: Police are responding to a shooting near the Hollywood Beach Broadwalk. A preliminary investigation shows that an altercation between two groups resulted in gunfire, police said.

title: In Memorial Day remarks, Biden honors troops who 'gave all' to protect democracy
description: President Biden marked the 155th anniversary of Memorial Day with remarks at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia.
